H0.text: Chemical energy is the energy form that, when a lightbulb is lit, electrical energy is converted into along with light energy.

H1.text: Magnetic energy is produced when a lightbulb is lit, as electrical energy is converted into light energy.

H2.text: Heat energy is the energy produced when a lightbulb is lit, converting electrical energy into light energy.

H3.text: Mechanical energy is the other form that electrical energy changes into when a lightbulb is lit, alongside light energy.

A4.text: Less than 5% of the energy they consume is converted into visible light; the rest is released as heat.

A5.text: The useful part of the emitted energy is visible light, but most energy is given off as heat in the near-infrared wavelengths.
